text: The Detroit River is a river in the Great Lakes system. The river connects Lake St. Clair to Lake Erie. It forms part of the border between Canada and the United States. It is long.U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. The National Map , accessed November 7, 2011 It divides the cities of Detroit and Windsor. It is one of the busiest waterways in the world. The name comes from the French Rivière du Détroit, which means River of the Strait. ==References== Category:Rivers of Canada Category:Rivers of Michigan Category:Geography of Ontario
title: Detroit River
